concept.title: Troubleshooting LDAP Settings
concept.shortdesc: What can go wrong with the LDAP setup?

conbody.p: After you set up the LDAP server, saslauthd, and LDAP administrators, some issues might remain such as:

ul.li: Firewall ports are not open for LDAP.
The Proxy did not start or has started with an inappropriate protocol or hostname.
The configuration of saslauthd is incorrect (look at /etc/sysconfig/saslauthd or /etc/saslauthd.conf)
The LDAP filters are not correct.
You can also encounter error messages from the system. These errors belong either to issues caused by saslauthd or the LDAP server.

dd.codeblock: ..... "dial unix /var/run.sasl2/mux: no such file or directory"
dd.p: Possible reason for the error: no LDAP server was installed.

ul.li: Before installing the server again, you can try to resolve the issue by creating a symboilic link as follows: ln -s /var/run/saslauthd/ /var/run/sasl2
If the suggested solution doesn't work, install the server and test it again.

dd.p: To fix this problem, chmod 755 to the directory to give access.

dlentry.dd: Look at the external LDAP server logs to find the cause.
